tit.e: Town Names in Kita Ward, Kyoto City
Town Names in Kita Ward, Kyoto City

sen.j: 本項京都市北区の町名（きょうとしきたくのちょうめい）では、同区内に存在する公称町名を一覧化するとともに、その成立時期・成立過程等について概説する。
sen.e: This section on 'Town Names in Kita Ward, Kyoto City' lists the official town names in the ward and describes when and how they were established.
This section on "Town names in Kita Ward, Kyoto City" lists official town names in Kita Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: This section on "Town names in Kita Ward, Kyoto City" lists official town names in Kita Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.

sen.j: 京都市街地の北方に位置する。
sen.e: Kita Ward is located in the north of the downtown of Kyoto City.
It is located in the north of Kyoto urban district.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: It is located in the north of Kyoto urban district.

sen.j: 区の南部は京都盆地北端に位置する市街地であり、北部は人口密度の低い山地である。
sen.e: Its southern part is an urban area along the northern edge of the Kyoto basin, whereas the northern part is a mountainous region with low population density.
Its southern part is an urban area along the northern edge of the Kyoto basin, whereas the northern part is a mountainous region with low population density.
Its southern part is an urban area along the northern edge of the Kyoto basin, whereas the northern part is a mountainous region with low population density.

sen.j: 東は京都市左京区、北から西は右京区、南は上京区に接する。
sen.e: The ward borders Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City in the east, Ukyo Ward from the north to the west, and Kamigyo Ward in the south.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The ward borders Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City in the east, Ukyo Ward from the north to the west, and Kamigyo Ward in the south.

sen.j: 南端のごく一部が中京区に接する。
sen.e: A tiny part of its southern edge borders Nakagyo Ward.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A tiny part of its southern edge borders Nakagyo Ward.

sen.j: 面積94.92平方キロメートル。
sen.e: The ward has an area of 94.92 square meters.
It covers an area of 94.92 square kilometers.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: It covers an area of 94.92 square kilometers.

sen.j: 2009年3月現在の推計人口は約122,000人。
sen.e: It had an estimated population of about 122,000 in March 2009.
Its population is estimated to be about 122,000 as of March 2009.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Its population is estimated to be about 122,000 as of March 2009.

sen.j: 区の大部分は山村地域で、いわゆる観光スポットはあまり多くない。
sen.e: It is mostly a rural area in the mountains with few sightseeing spots.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is mostly a rural area in the mountains with few sightseeing spots.

sen.j: 南部には鹿苑寺（金閣寺）、大徳寺、上賀茂神社（賀茂別雷神社）、正伝寺、光悦寺などの著名社寺がある。
sen.e: In the southern part, however, there are famous shrines and temples such as Rokuon-ji Temple (Kinkaku-ji Temple), Daitoku-ji Temple, Kamigamo-jinja Shrine (Kamo-Wake-Ikazuchi-jinja Shrine), Shoden-ji Temple, and Koetsu-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

In the southern part, however, there are famous shrines and temples such as Rokuon-ji Temple (Kinkaku-ji Temple), Daitoku-ji Temple, Kamigamo-jinja Shrine (Kamo-Wake-Ikazuchi-jinja Shrine), Shoden-ji Temple, and Koetsu-ji Temple.

sen.j: 当区は昭和30年（1955年）、上京区から分区して成立した。
sen.e: Separated from Kamigyo Ward, the ward was established in 1955.
Separated from Kamigyo Ward, the ward was established in 1955.
Separated from Kamigyo Ward, the ward was established in 1955.

sen.j: 区のおおむね南半分は大正7年（1918年）及び昭和6年（1931年）に愛宕郡（おたぎぐん）及び葛野郡（かどのぐん）から当時の上京区に編入された区域である。
sen.e: The southern half of the ward roughly consists of towns transferred from the Counties of Otagi and Kadono to the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918 and 1931.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The southern half of the ward roughly consists of towns transferred from the Counties of Otagi and Kadono to the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918 and 1931.
The southern half of the ward roughly consists of towns transferred from the Counties of Otagi and Kadono to the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918 and 1931.

sen.j: おおむね北半分は昭和23年及び24年（1948・1949年）、上記2郡から当時の上京区に編入された区域である。
sen.e: The northern half largely comprises the towns transferred from the counties to the then Kamigyo Ward in 1948 and 1949.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The northern half largely comprises the towns transferred from the above-mentioned counties to the then Kamigyo Ward in 1948 and 1949.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部を小文字に変更しました。

sen.j: 京都市内の町名には「大原来迎院町」のように旧村名、旧大字名に由来する地名（上記例の場合は「大原」）を冠称するものと、「亀屋町」「菊屋町」のような単独町名とがある。
sen.e: Like 'Ohara Raikoin-cho,' some town names in Kyoto City indicate broad regions ('Ohara' in the case just cited) derived from the names of the former villages or 'Oaza' (administrative units below a town).

The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho.'
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho.'

sen.j: 北区内の町名は南端部の9町と金閣寺町のみが単独町名で、他は旧大字名などの地区名を冠した複合町名である。
sen.e: With the exception of Kinkakuji-cho and nine towns along the southern edge which have all independent town names, the other towns in Kita Ward have compound town names which begin with broader regional designations of the former Oaza, etc.

With the exception of Kinkakuji-cho and nine towns along the southern edge which have all independent town names, the other towns in Kita Ward have compound town names which are prefixed by the district names such as former Oaza (large section of village).
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: With the exception of Kinkakuji-cho and nine towns along the southern edge which have all independent town names, the other towns in Kita Ward have compound town names which are prefixed by the district names such as former Oaza (large section of village).

sen.j: 区内の公称町名の数は、『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』下巻によれば1980年現在435町であった。
sen.e: According to the second volume of "Kadokawa's Geographical Dictionary of Japan, 26: Kyoto Prefecture," the ward had 435 official town names in 1980.

According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 435 declared towns as of 1980.

sen.e: Some town names in the ward have no designation of '町'(town) as for example in 'Omiya Akibasan' or 'Nishigamo Funayama.'

sen.j: これらは、山間部などで、昭和6年の町名成立時において当該区域内に人家が存在しなかったものである。

sen.j: 昭和40年（1965年）、当時の京都市内各所に残存していた「大字○○字XX」の区域はすべて「町」となり、「○○XX町」と改称された。
sen.e: In 1965 the areas designated 'Aza XYZ, Oaza ABC' which still remained across Kyoto City all became towns and were renamed 'ABC XYZ-town.'

sen.e: In 1965, in Kyoto City, all the districts whose names included the terms 'Oaza' and 'Aza' ('Aza' means a small section of a village) were renamed with the suffix 'cho,' so a place called 'Oaza XX Aza YY' would have been renamed 'XXYY-cho.'

sen.e: Towns broadly designated 'Murasakino,' 'Shichiku,' and 'Omiya' formed a larger part of Omiya Village, Otagi County, except a few areas which belonged to Noguchi Village, Otagi County.

sen.j: 愛宕郡大宮村は一部が大正7年（1918年）、残余が昭和6年（1931年）、当時の上京区に編入された。
sen.e: A part of Omiya Village, Otagi County was incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918 and the rest in 1931.

sen.j: 昭和40年（1965年）、当時の京都市内各所に残存していた「大字○○字XX」の区域はすべて「町」となり、「○○XX町」と改称された。
sen.e: In 1965 the areas designated 'Aza XYZ, Oaza ABC' which still remained across Kyoto City all became towns and were renamed 'ABC XYZ-town.'

In 1965, in Kyoto City, all the districts whose names included the terms 'Oaza' and 'Aza' ('Aza' means a small section of a village) were renamed with the suffix 'cho,' so a place called 'Oaza XX Aza YY' would have been renamed 'XXYY-cho.'

sen.e: In 1965 the areas designated 'Aza XYZ, Oaza ABC' which still remained across Kyoto City all became towns and were renamed 'ABC XYZ-town.'

In 1965, in Kyoto City, all the districts whose names included the terms 'Oaza' and 'Aza' ('Aza' means a small section of a village) were renamed with the suffix 'cho,' so a place called 'Oaza XX Aza YY' would have been renamed 'XXYY-cho.'
